image.altText: A young blonde girl smiles at the camera

items.synopsis: Tasmania Police have charged a 36-year-old man with the murder of teenager Shyanne-Lee Tatnell, after human remains were found in bushland in Tasmania's north-east

title.children: Tasmania Police charge man with murder of teenager Shyanne-Lee Tatnell

image.altText: A man in a cap walks down some stairs holding rail

items.synopsis: A Hobart court hears a convicted paedophile transferred hundreds of thousands of dollars, property and shares to family and friends in the days before his sentence began. His victim argues it was all to thwart a claim for damages.

title.children: 'Get it done and ignore the legal letter': Court hears allegations wealthy sex offender shed assets to avoid payout

image.altText: Middle aged man close up of his face in a car, photographer in background

items.synopsis: Lawyers for Tim Mathieson, the former partner of Julia Gillard, say he will plead guilty to a charge of sexual assault during a hearing in the Melbourne Magistrates' Court.

title.children: Tim Mathieson, former partner of Julia Gillard, to plead guilty to sexual assault charge

image.altText: Greg Jenkins 1

items.synopsis: The Reserve Bank is hiking interest rates — and hitting borrowers — to fight high inflation, but data suggests the fight is being undermined by big-spending baby boomers.

title.children: 'We're not paying the price': The boomers boosting inflation as the RBA lifts rates to fight it

image.altText: A composite image of Kevin Spacey clutching an Oscar and a court sketch

items.synopsis: The trial against Kevin Spacey was a strange mix of celebrity witnesses, tearful testimony and graphic allegations of sexual violence. WARNING: Some readers may find details in this story distressing.

title.children: Kevin Spacey was one of the biggest names hit by #MeToo. Here's why a London court cleared him

image.altText: Three Portuguese players celebrate on the football pitch after scoring a goal

items.synopsis: Portugal and Vietnam face off in a game neither can lose, as their hopes of qualifying for the next round hang by a thread.

title.children: Portgual leads Vietnam 2-0 with World Cup survival on the line

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: It was coming. A poor goal kick from Vietnam keeper Tran Thi Kim Thanh ended at the feet of a Portgugal player. Telma Encarnação played the perfect pass along the ground, into the box for  Kika Nazareth who made no mistake with just the goalkeeper in front of her.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 21': Goal Portugal, 2-0

children.content: A poor goal kick from Vietnam keeper
Tran Thi Kim Thanh ended at the feet of a Portgugal player.
Telma Encarnação played the perfect pass along the ground, into the box for  Kika Nazareth who made no mistake with just the goalkeeper in front of her.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Just the start Portugal needed. An outstanding run down the left by Lúcia Alves led to her feeding a fabulous cross into the box. Number 23 Telma Encarnação was there to get her right foot onto the ball and bulge the back of the net.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 7': GOAL PORTUGAL

children.content: An outstanding run down the left by Lúcia Alves led to her feeding a fabulous cross into the box.
Telma Encarnação was there to get her right foot onto the ball and bulge the back of the net.

image.altText: Bald man in army greens holding a gun in front of white wall.

items.synopsis: One of the top leaders in the Russian Army, Sergei Surovikin, has not been seen since the mutiny against the Kremlin last month. At first it seems odd, but it turns out General Surovikin is not who he seems.

title.children: Russian 'General Armageddon' Sergei Surovikin is missing — is he 'resting' or Resting In Peace?

image.altText: A composite image of Sinead O'Conner and Prince

items.synopsis: Despite being Sinéad O'Connor's most recognisable song, Nothing Compares 2 U originally came from the pen of Prince.

title.children: Nothing Compares 2 U: How the song of 1990 went from Prince to Sinéad and back again

image.altText: Sinead O'connor wearing a priests black outfit with a cross holding a microphone and smiling

items.synopsis: Irish singer-songwriter Sinéad O'Connor, who became a superstar in her mid-20s, dies at 56.

title.children: Sinéad O'Connor, who topped charts in the 90s, dies aged 56

image.altText: Riders on a mountain bike trail through a forest.

items.synopsis: Dorset Council, in Tasmania's north-east, is being warned it may be suspended after allegations of conflicts of interest, poor governance and disrespect for community members.

title.children: Tasmanian council facing suspension as minister appoints board of inquiry

image.altText: A woman wearing a police hat

items.synopsis: Senior NSW Police officers deny losing control of the escalating drug wars across Sydney but admit they are up against a "wall of silence". Five people have been shot in five days — two of them fatally.

title.children: Police deny losing control of drug war as man dies days after Sydney car ambush

image.altText: Woman smiling on airbike

items.synopsis: Incontinence is a health issue affecting one in four Australians, but shame and embarrassment often stop people from seeking help, writes Caitlyn Davey.

title.children: A bladder condition nearly destroyed my kidneys and made me realise we need to talk about incontinence

image.altText: Image of couple in front of cancelled and sign and Metricon label

items.synopsis: Metricon, the biggest home builder in the country, has told some customers to pay painfully higher prices or risk losing their new homes and deposits in a contract nightmare affecting home owners.

title.children: Building giant tells buyers to pay hundreds of thousands extra or lose homes and deposits

image.altText: Two Minimocursor phunoiensis, who have pink heads, orange beak-like mouths, long necks and tiny arms

items.synopsis: Researchers say the young creature, which was about the size of a dog, is "one of the best-preserved dinosaurs ever found in South-East Asia".

title.children: New species of dinosaur discovered in Thailand

image.altText: Kirrawee nursing home Joan Hobbs

items.synopsis: The family of Joan Hobbs have called for better staffing after the 89-year-old woman was attacked by a fellow dementia patient with a walking frame.

title.children: Elderly woman allegedly bashed to death by fellow dementia patient in Sydney nursing home

image.altText: Composite image of football fans from the 32 nations competing at the FIFA Women's World Cup

items.synopsis: With the FIFA Women's World Cup in full swing, fans all around Australia show their true colours and share their passion for the world game, and their country.

title.children: Here's what it means to football fans from all over the world to see a Women's World Cup here

image.altText: The back of a man and a woman looking out across a ledge where smoke burns

items.synopsis: As temperatures rise and seas warm experts say there is a lot more to consider when planning your next overseas holiday..

title.children: Popular holiday destinations are paying the price of climate change. Here's how tourists don't have to

image.altText: Jerome Powell stands at a podium behind a wall of American flags.

items.synopsis: The ASX set a 100-day high, after the Federal Reserve hiked interest rates to a 22-year high.

title.children: ASX at five-month high, Fed raises rates as expected, EY staff bullied and overworked — as it happened

image.altText: A couple in their backyard.

items.synopsis: Although it's been in planning for more than 20 years, a dozen families on the Sunshine Coast are reeling after the shock discovery that their homes will be acquired for a major new road and rail project, the Mooloolah River Interchange.

title.children: Residents shocked by 'railway through our back patio' as homes to be bulldozed for transport corridor

image.altText: A speed gun showing 253 kilometres per hour.

items.synopsis: The 20-year-old Adelaide man pleaded guilty to a string of offences committed on multiple occasions including illegal use of a motor vehicle and driving at extreme speed.

title.children: L-plater caught driving at 'extraordinary speed' jailed

image.altText: A man in high-vis sits on a ride-on lawnmower at night. He is being stopped by police.

items.synopsis: The North Queenslander told officers he thought he would "ride this old girl over" to mow his daughter's lawn. Police say his breath test result proves there is nothing "funny " about the incident.

title.children: 'Whack it on me': Allegedly drunk lawnmower driver filmed explaining 1am journey to police

image.altText: A woman in a green top stands against a stone wall.

items.synopsis: Sarab was 11 when ISIS militants attacked her village and sold her into slavery. Five years later, she had been given to six different men. Now, she wants justice, writes Stephanie March.

title.children: Abducted and sold into slavery at 11, now Sarab wants justice

image.altText: ukraine ships

items.synopsis: Russia refuses to speak at a UN Security Council meeting called to discuss Moscow's recent devastating attacks on the key Ukranian port of Odesa immediately following its exit from the Black Sea grain deal.

title.children: Russia refuses to speak at UN meeting on Ukraine port attacks, calls meeting on religious freedom in Ukraine

image.altText: An older man in navy suit with bright blue tie stands next to young man in formal military uniform

items.synopsis: Hun Sen has ruled Cambodia for almost 40 years. Now, he is handing power to his son.

title.children: Cambodia's PM wears $1m watches as much of the country lives in poverty. Now, his son is taking over

image.altText: Photograph outside the Australian Tax Office headquarters

items.synopsis: The Australian Tax Office privately settled with PwC over an undisclosed matter in March, as the firm contended with a confidentiality breach within its ranks.

title.children: PwC reveals private settlement over undisclosed matter with Tax Office, as it contended with unfolding tax leak saga

image.altText: The view over nepal from a paraglider.

items.synopsis: Two New South Wales men have become the first people to legally paraglide from a 5,200-metre peak in the Everest region of Nepal, capturing spectacular footage for a charity film.

title.children: Aussie paragliders achieve world first with 5,200m-high launch from Nepalese mountains

image.altText: A portrait of an Aboriginal man with a short beard and a black wide-brimmed hat

items.synopsis: A third person charged with the alleged murder of well-known Aurukun leader Bruce Martin has appeared in court in North Queensland.

title.children: Third person in court charged with alleged murder of prominent Indigenous leader in Townsville

image.altText: A blonde, dark-eyed woman in a beanie with a quizzical expression on her face.

items.synopsis: Jennifer Blanke's "chaotic and unstable existence" at the time of the offences was taken into account by the court.

title.children: Fake dog groomer dodges jail after attempt to scam $115k out of ATO

image.altText: Ria Andriani wears a pale blue jumper, facing the camera in a portrait taken inside her home.

items.synopsis: Many Australian utility companies don't provide bills in accessible formats, and Australia's laws make it difficult to force them to.

title.children: A 'serious disadvantage': Thousands of Australians like Ria are sent utility bills they cannot read

image.altText: An elderly man at a podium looks bewildered while two other senators touch his arm

items.synopsis: The 81-year-old Kentucky senator is briefly led away from the conference after trailing off mid-sentence.

title.children: US senator Mitch McConnell freezes up and stares off vacantly for 20 seconds  during press conference

image.altText: An african man sitting infront of a white table and microphone with nine men in military uniforms behind him

items.synopsis: Colonel Amadou Abdramane appears in a video saying Niger's defence forces are putting an end to President Mohamed Bazoum's regime.

title.children: Niger soldiers remove president, seize power in coup
